command.prompt:
Generate one new row for a table of information about mythical creatures. The semi-colon-separated header of attributes for the table is:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin

Do not generate fictional rows. Generate the rows from real known data. Here is a list of semi-colon-separated rows not to generate by semantic key only:
Word
Chimera
Siren
Basilisk
Minotaur
Cyclops
Unicorns
Pegasus
Centaur
Gorgon
Phoenix
Hydra
Cerberus
Nymph

Output the row in the format of a semi-colon-separated .csv file with a column header. Then explain the source of the new data.
command.output_table:
Word;Definition;Synonyms;Origin
Satyr;A creature with the upper body of a man and the lower body and legs of a goat;Faun, Pan;Greek mythology
command.epilogue:
In Greek mythology, a Satyr (also known as a Faun or Pan for Romans) is a male nature spirit with the upper body of a human and the lower body and legs of a goat. They are often depicted as being lustful and rowdy, accompanying Dionysus, the god of wine, in his revelries. Satyrs are also associated with music and dance, often seen playing pipes or other instruments.

Source: Encyclopedia Britannica (<https://www.britannica.com/topic/satyr-Greek-mythology>) /

Definition.0: A creature with the upper body of a man and the lower body and legs of a goat
